snippet: An institute at the City University of New York Graduate Center found that unionized black workers in the city were paid significantly higher than their nonunionized counterparts.
abstract: Report issued by Murphy Institute for Worker Education and Labor Studies at the City University of New York shows unionized black workers in New York City enjoy better pay and benefits than nonunion black workers; data suggests unionization could help blacks across country; nearly 40 percent of city's black workers are unionized, compared with 15 percent in rest of country.
lead_paragraph: An institute at the City University of New York Graduate Center found that unionized black workers in the city were paid significantly higher than their nonunionized counterparts.

headline.main: Unionization Important to Closing Racial Wage Gap, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Study Says Unionizing Helps Close Racial Wage Gap
